title: Young Archaeologists' Club: Ancient Celebrations
desc: 12 December 10.30am - 12.15pm ? 8-16yrs Want to learn about Archaeology but don't know where to start? Then the Fulham Palace Young Archaeologists' Club is the place for you. Meeting monthly on Saturday mornings the club will explore the fascinating world of archaeology through practical hands on sessions with real archaeologists. You'll dig, sieve, measure and record your finds learning about ancient civilisations such as the Roman, Viking and Stone Age eras. There will be a huge range of sessions on offer, everything from dendrochronology to investigating historic buildings, making  traditional crafts to exploring the local Thames foreshore. During th is session we look at what  Ancient cultures did before there was Christmas. Did they celebrate in the winter like we do? If so what did they do and what did they eat?   You can either book for this session only or sign up for the whole term's membership to take part in all?4 sessions; 19th September -Totally Thames 24th October -?Bones and Burials 21st November - Investigating Historic Buildings 12th December - Ancient Celebrations Bursary places?are available, contact  education@fulhampalace.org  to learn more.
